diagnosis.vascularInvolvement: Abuts SMV (<180 degrees), no SMA involvement.
diagnosis.pathologicStage: Borderline Resectable cT2 N0 M0 Stage IB
diagnosis.symptomsAtPresentation: Painless jaundice, dark urine, mild back pain, weight loss.
pathologyFindings: EUS-guided biopsy of pancreatic head mass confirms Adenocarcinoma, moderately differentiated.
Sampled peripancreatic lymph node negative for malignant cells.

treatmentPlan.modality: External Beam Radiation Therapy (EBRT) with concurrent Chemotherapy (following induction chemo)
treatmentPlan.targetVolumeSummary: PTV encompassing pancreatic head tumor + margin, potentially including draining nodal regions. Includes peri-pancreatic lymphatics.
treatmentPlan.detailedConcurrentChemo: Capecitabine PO BID during radiation (Managed by Dr. Johnson). Start 1 day prior to RT.
medications: Pancreatic Enzymes (e.g., Creon) if needed for insufficiency
therapistAlerts: High risk for nausea and GI side effects. Monitor daily.
Assess hydration and nutrition status daily.
Patient taking oral chemotherapy (Capecitabine); reinforce compliance instructions and side effects.

ctSimulation.setupInstructions: Supine in BodyFix or VacLok bag, abdominal compression may be used. 4D-CT simulation to manage respiratory motion. SAD setup. Ensure bladder is full and consistent.
ctSimulation.immobilization: BodyFix or VacLok bag, abdominal compression.
ctSimulation.referenceMarks: 3-point tattoos at isocenter projections (AP and bilateral laterals). Supplemental marks for visual setup on skin.
ctSimulation.contrastUsed: IV Contrast and oral contrast (for bowel delineation) likely used. Ensure no contraindications.
ctSimulation.ctNotes: 4D-CT acquired with immobilization/compression. Motion assessed and deemed acceptable. Data acquired for IMRT planning. Fused with diagnostic CT abdomen/pelvis for target and OAR delineation. Isocenter placed at geometric center of PTV.

dosimetry.planStatus: Final - Approved by Dr. Robert Evans
dosimetry.constraints: Kidney Mean < 18 Gy; Stomach Max < 54 Gy; Bowel Max < 54 Gy; Spinal Cord Max < 45 Gy; Liver Mean < 30 Gy
dosimetry.planNotes: Neoadjuvant IMRT for borderline resectable pancreatic cancer. Daily CBCT for IGRT. Avoidance of critical structures (kidneys, stomach, small bowel) was prioritized during optimization. Plan exhibits good coverage and conformity.

igrtProtocol.alignment: Soft tissue match to GTV/pancreas head. Verify stomach and small bowel position relative to PTV.

fractions.fieldsAndMUs: Field 1 (62 MU), Field 2 (78 MU), Field 3 (71 MU), Field 4 (66 MU), Field 5 (72 MU), Field 6 (77 MU), Field 7 (61 MU) - Total: 487 MU
fractions.organTargetChecks: CBCT reviewed, good alignment of pancreas/target. Bowel position acceptable.
fractions.shiftsApplied: V: -0.2 cm, L: 0.1 cm, S: 0 cm
fractions.igrtVerificationNotes: Minor shifts for optimal target coverage.
fractions.instructionsGiven: Continue oral chemo as prescribed. Maintain hydration.
fractions.dailyNotes: Patient tolerated treatment well. No acute issues. CBCT match within protocol.

fractions.fieldsAndMUs: Field 1 (62 MU), Field 2 (78 MU), Field 3 (71 MU), Field 4 (66 MU), Field 5 (72 MU), Field 6 (77 MU), Field 7 (61 MU) - Total: 487 MU
fractions.organTargetChecks: CBCT reviewed, good alignment of pancreas/target. Bowel position acceptable.
fractions.instructionsGiven: Encouraged small, frequent meals. Recommended nutritional supplement.
fractions.dailyNotes: Patient cooperative. Discussed diet with patient. CBCT match excellent.

fractions.fieldsAndMUs: Field 1 (62 MU), Field 2 (78 MU), Field 3 (71 MU), Field 4 (66 MU), Field 5 (72 MU), Field 6 (77 MU), Field 7 (61 MU) - Total: 487 MU
fractions.organTargetChecks: CBCT reviewed, good alignment of pancreas/target. No significant bowel distension.
fractions.shiftsApplied: V: 0.1 cm, L: 0 cm, S: 0.1 cm
fractions.siteSpecificSideEffects: Reports mild abdominal discomfort after meals.
fractions.instructionsGiven: Recommended antacids for heartburn, continue small meals, rest as needed.
fractions.dailyNotes: Patient remains active. Discussed symptom management. Plan adherence good.

imagingAndReports.summary: 3cm hypodense mass head of pancreas, abutting SMV. Dilated biliary ducts.

reportDetails.specimenSource: EUS-guided Fine Needle Aspiration (FNA) and Biopsy: 1) Pancreatic head mass, 2) Peripancreatic lymph node (Station 8a).
reportDetails.finalDiagnosis:
1. PANCREATIC HEAD MASS, FNA AND BIOPSY: ADENOCARCINOMA, MODERATELY DIFFERENTIATED (GRADE 2).
2. PERIPANCREATIC LYMPH NODE (STATION 8A), FNA: NEGATIVE FOR MALIGNANT CELLS.
reportDetails.microscopicDescription: The specimen from the pancreatic mass consists of core biopsy fragments and smears showing infiltrating glandular structures lined by atypical epithelial cells with enlarged, pleomorphic nuclei and prominent nucleoli. Mitotic figures are identified. The specimen from the lymph node consists of smears showing a population of benign, reactive lymphoid elements only. No malignant cells are seen.
reportDetails.comment: The findings are diagnostic of adenocarcinoma of the pancreas. The sampled peripancreatic lymph node shows no evidence of metastasis, which is important for staging and surgical planning.

imagingAndReports.summary: Interval decrease in tumor size to 2.5cm. Continued abutment of SMV. Stable disease/slight response.

labResults.notes: Within normal limits prior to RT.
Stable electrolytes and liver function during RT.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Evans
progressNotes.summary: Patient seen for weekly on-treatment visit. Tolerating RT and concurrent Capecitabine well. Mild fatigue. No significant GI issues. Continue plan as prescribed.

progressNotes.author: RN Smith
progressNotes.summary: Patient reports continued good tolerance. Discussed skin care and diet. No new concerns. Encouraged small, frequent meals.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Evans
progressNotes.summary: Week 2 RT visit. Patient reports mild fatigue and occasional heartburn, managed with OTC antacids. Continues Capecitabine. Skin integrity good. Plan to continue RT as scheduled.

progressNotes.author: RN Chen
progressNotes.summary: Patient presented with mild fatigue and reported feeling 'a bit full' after meals. Reviewed dietary strategies. Skin remains clear, no erythema. Vitals stable.

patientEducation.goalsDiscussed: Treatment intent (neoadjuvant), daily treatment process, importance of daily CBCTs for accurate targeting. Discussed overall treatment timeline including post-RT surgery.
patientEducation.sideEffectsReviewed: Fatigue (common, rest as needed), skin irritation (use aquaphor/aloe, avoid harsh soaps), nausea/vomiting (medications available, small frequent meals), diarrhea (loperamide PRN). Explained signs of infection to report immediately.
patientEducation.safetyConsiderations: Radiation safety protocols (remain still, hold breath if instructed), reporting new or worsening symptoms promptly (especially fever, severe pain, or bleeding). Avoiding sun exposure to treated area.
patientEducation.patientResponsibilities: Compliance with Capecitabine (take with food, avoid antacids within 2 hours of dose), daily skin care, keeping all appointments (RT, MD, labs), maintaining hydration and nutrition, reporting all new symptoms.
patientEducation.medicationCompliance: Reinforced importance of taking Capecitabine exactly as prescribed (dose, timing). Reviewed potential interactions with other medications and supplements. Provided written instructions and pharmacy contact.

cptCharges.description: Radiation Therapy, SBRT/IMRT, 1 treatment area, 1-5 fractions
Office or other outpatient visit, established patient
